page.title: 16ST. STEPHEN'S CHURCH.
page.content: St. Stephen & All Martyrs Church of England is situated on Radcliffe Road and is commonly known as Lever Bridge Church because of the nearby bridge over the River Tonge. The building, whose architect was Edmund Sharpe, took over 2 years to complete and was consecrated by the Bishop of Chester in 1845. It is built from terra-cotta clay found at Ladyshaw Pit at Little Lever owned by the Fletchers and it was transported by barge along the Manchester_Bolton- Bury Canal. Terra-cotta is a porous material which is apt to crumble, hence the removal of the spire,and later the 'lantern' by the local steeplejack,Fred Dibnah. The decorative features of the interior of the church are all made of terra-cotta and the only stone item is the font. The present vicar is Rev.S. Rudkin.
